title: Will there be a season 3 of Succession?
text:
Succession season 2 came to an end this week. (HBO)

Succession, the popular HBO show that’s been garnering praise (and an Emmy Award) for its writing and the performances of the cast, premiered its nail-biting season finale last night as season 2 came to a jaw dropping and surprising crescendo.

The show has been following the lives of the wealthy Roy family for two seasons now as they contemplate and negotiate their futures in light of their father’s decision to take a step back from running the successful media conglomerate he controls.

Set on a superyacht, the season finale of series two saw the family of billionaire Logan Roy (Brian Cox) turn on each other as they tried to decide who should be sacrificed to save the company.

But with season two coming to such a captivating close, can fans look forward to a third season?

Will there be a season 3 of Succession?

If watching savage power struggles and scintillating family drama is your thing then rejoice Succession fans, because the hit HBO series has been renewed for a third season.

Season three of Succession will be released on HBO in the summer of 2020 and will be released on Sky Atlantic and NOW TV shortly after.

Talking about what the next season of Succession might have in store, star Brian Cox told The Daily Beast: ‘There are a lot of things to be explored in season three. The succession itself is still to be explored; how to keep Waystar together and stop it from going under; how to stop the proxy battle and company takeover.

‘Roman has suddenly risen, and will emerge quite strongly I think.’

Brian Cox’s character Logan will return for season 3 (Picture: Peter Kramer/HBO)

The exact date that the new series will drop on our screens is yet to be announced, but after a return to top form for the show with the second series, we can’t wait to see what the show’s creators have in store for season three.

description: With season two of Succession coming to such a captivating close, can fans look forward to a third season of the hit HBO show next year?
